full_text: Screened by NARA, 9/14/2023 Part 4. Eligibility to Sponsor (Continued) D Sponsor's Annual Household Income Enter total unadjusted income from your most recent Federal income tax return below. You may also list total income your spouse (if you have been married for at lease 6 months) sons, daughters, and parents currently living with you in yc household for the previous 6 months if they will make their income available for the support of the sponsor immigrant(s). You must attach copies of income tax returns as filed with the IRS for the Last 3 tax years for yourself and all persons who income is listed below (See "Required Evidence" in instructions.). Income from all 3 years will be considered in determini your ability to support the immigrant(s) you are sponsoring. If any of the persons listed below had no legal obligation file U.S. Federal income tax returns, you may include their annual income below and present evidence of their income the past 3 years. 1996 Indicate most recent tax year (year) Sponsor's income S 27628 or Sponsor and spouse's combined income $ (If filing joint tax return) Income of other persons in household who will make their income available (list names; include spouse if heishe filed a separate tax return) $ $ S Total $ Explain if you or any of the above listed individuals are submitting income tax returns for fewer than 3 years, or if other explanation of income or evidence is necessary. E. Determination of Eligibility Based on Income 1. I am subject to the 100 percent of poverty line requirement for sponsors on active duty in the U.S. Armed Force sponsoring a spouse and/or child. All others use 125 percent. 2. Number of dependents from Part 4.C., line 5 5 3. Minimum income requirement from the Poverty Guidelines chart is $ 22775-105 this number of depender A consular or immigration officer will review your ability to maintain income based on your current employment and Federal tax returns for the past 3 years. If your total household income from Part 4. D. is equal to or higher than the poverty line for the number of dependents in Part 4. C., and your current employment demonstrates your ability to support the sponsored immigrant(s), you are not required to list assets in Part 4. F. You may skip to Part 7. If your total household income form Part 4. D. is below the poverty line for the number of dependents in Part C., you and/or the sponsored alien(s) may submit evidence of assets, or a joint sponsor may execute a separate affidavit of support. (See Part 4. F., Part 5, and Part 6.)
